titleText.defaultText: Everything you need to know about:

pageText.defaultText: Introduction

Congratulations on acquiring your new vehicle. Please take the time to get well acquainted with your vehicle by reading this handbook. The more you know and understand about your vehicle, the greater the safety and pleasure you will derive from driving it.
For more information on IVLabs and its products visit the following website:
https://bit.ly/iv_labs
P. 65 Warning

Engine exhaust, some of its constituents, and certain engine fluids contain or emit chemicals known to the State of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm. In addition, certain fluids contained in radiator and certain products of component wear contain or emit chemicals known to the State of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm.
Safety

Each seating position in your vehicle has a specific safety belt assembly which is made up of one buckle and one tongue that are designed to be used as a pair. Use the shoulder belt on the outside shoulder only.
Do not wear the shoulder belt under the arm. Do not use a single safety belt for more than one person.

Use of Mobile Communications Equipment has become increasingly important in the conduct of business and personal affairs. However, drivers must not compromise their own or others’ safety when using such equipment. Mobile Communications can enhance personal safety and security when appropriately used, particularly in emergency situations. Safety must be paramount when using mobile communications equipment to avoid negating these benefits.
Driver Controls
Speed Control

Some vehicles come equipped with automatic Speed Control.
With speed control set, you can maintain a speed of 48 km/h (30 mph) or more without keeping your foot on the accelerator pedal. The controls for using your speed control are located on the control panel for your convenience.

Use the accelerator pedal to get to the desired speed. When the vehicle reaches that speed press and release the CRUISE control.
To turn off speed control press and release the CRUISE control. This will erase the previously set speed control.
Power Boost

Electric vehicles come equipped with Power Boost.
With Power Boost control set, the electric motor(s) in your vehicle will put out maximum motor power, in comparison to economy mode.
Extensive use of Power Boost may result in increased wear to the tires and motor(s).

Switch BOOST control to ON to activate Power Boost. Your vehicle's drivetrain will adapt accordingly to put out maximum power.
To turn off power boost switch BOOST control tp OFF. This will reset the vehicle's drivetrain to economy mode.
Climate Temperature

Some vehicles come equipped with Climate Temperature Control.
With climate control set, yoiur vehicle's cabin will be warmed or cooled automatically. The controls for adjusting the climate control are located on the control panel for your convenience.
Switch A/C control to ON to activate Climate Temperature control.

Your vehicle's A/C compressors and/or heaters will activate accordingly depending on interior and exterior temperatures.
To turn off Climate Temperature control switch A/C control to OFF.
Driving
Ignition [ICE]

I. OFF/LOCK, shuts off the engine and all accessories and allows key removal.
II. ON, all electrical circuits operational. Key position when driving.
III. START, cranks the engine. Release the key as soon as the engine starts.
Ignition [Electric]

I. OFF/LOCK, shuts off the engine and all accessories and allows key removal.
II. Key will trigger III's function past this position
III. ON, all electrical circuits and drivetrain systems operational. Key position when driving.
Emergencies

In an unavoidable emergency situation where a sudden sharp turn must be made, remember to avoid “over-driving” your vehicle (i.e., turn the steering wheel only as rapidly and as far as required to avoid the emergency).
Excessive steering will result in less vehicle control, not more.

Additionally, smooth variations of the accelerator and/or brake pedal pressure should be utilized if changes in vehicle speed are called for. Avoid abrupt steering, acceleration or braking which could result in an increased risk of loss of vehicle control, vehicle rollover and/or personal injury. Use all available road surface to return the vehicle to a safe direction of travel.
Maintenance
Battery

Your vehicle is equipped with a Magnetocraft maintenance-free battery which normally does not require additional water during its life of service.
For longer, trouble-free operation, keep the top of the battery clean and dry. Also, make certain the battery cables are always tightly fastened to the battery terminals.
Engine

Only use oils “Certified For Gasoline Engines” by the Applicative Petroleum Institute (API). To protect your engine’s warranty use Magnetocraft or an equivalent oil meeting IVLabs specification WWI-SM8FJC-C.
Ensure the oil viscosity rating matches that which is specified for your engine.
Tires

Under-inflation is the most common cause of tire failures and may result in severe tire cracking, tread separation or ''blowout'', with unexpected loss of vehicle control and increased risk of injury. Under-inflation increases sidewall flexing and rolling resistance, resulting in internal damage to the tire. It also may result in loss of vehicle control and accidents.
Emissions

Your vehicle is equipped with a computer that monitors the engine’s emission control system. This system is commonly known as the On Board Diagnostics System (OBD-III). This OBD-III system protects the environment by ensuring that your vehicle continues to meet government emission standards. The OBD-III system also assists the service technician in properly servicing your vehicle.
Accessories

A wide selection of Genuine Atlas Accessories are available for your vehicle through your local authorized IVLabs dealer. These top quality accessories have been specifically engineered to fulfill your automotive needs; they are custom designed to complement the style and aerodynamic appearance of your vehicle.

In addition, each accessory is made from high quality materials and meets or exceeds IVLabs’s rigorous engineering and safety specifications. Atlas Motor Productions will repair or replace any properly dealer-installed Genuine IVLabs Accessory found to be defective in factory-supplied materials or workmanship during the warranty period, as well as any component damaged by the defective accessory.
